visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#00008B) for the axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. The x-axis should have categories for each month from January to December. The y-axis should have a title 'Temperature (°C)' in bold. Data series: The series should be named 'Temperature' and contain the data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4]. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#00008B) for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray (#F5F5F5), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with a title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The x-axis is labeled with months from January to December, and the y-axis is labeled with 'Temperature (°C)' in bold. The axis labels and titles are styled with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The data series is named 'Temperature' and contains the given monthly temperature data. The series color is set to a gradient from light blue to dark blue. The chart background is set to a light gray, and the legend is positioned at the bottom center of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure ample space around the chart elements.
